text: The <extra_id_0> Ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase (CaMK) type IV/Gr <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is selectively expressed in T lymphocytes and is activated after signaling via the T cell antigen receptor ( TCR ) , indicating that it mediates some of the Ca ( 2+ ) - dependent transcriptional events that follow TCR engagement .

text: Here we show that <extra_id_0> CaMKIV/Gr <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces the transcription factor activation protein 1 ( AP-1 ) alone or in synergy with T cell mitogens and with the <extra_id_0> p21ras <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> oncoprotein .

<extra_id_0> CaMKIV/ Gr <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling is associated with transcriptional activation of <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> but is independent of <extra_id_0> p21ras <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or calcineurin .

AP-1 is an integral component of the nuclear factor of activated T cells ( NFAT ) transcriptional complex , which is required for <extra_id_0> interleukin 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in T cells .

text: We demonstrate that <extra_id_0> CaMKIV/Gr <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reconstitutes the capacity of the cytosolic component of NFAT to direct transcription from NFAT sites in non-T cells .
These results reveal a central role for <extra_id_0> CaMKIV/Gr <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as a Ca ( 2+ ) - regulated activator of gene transcription in T lymphocytes .
